adrFormatAddress: 3395 Broadway, New York, NY 10031-7416, USA

originalText.text:
The purpose of this review is not to hate or harm this restaurant in any way, shape, or form. That being said, I hope you take this review as an informative review.

Atmosphere: Spacious, bright, and clean for the most part. It is also a bit noisy, but I understand that they have to communicate in some way.

Service: I think service can vary depending on who takes your order. There are some employees that are more friendly and others who just keep it simple.

Food: I ordered the Ball Plantain with Chicken, which does not really look like a ball. It looks more like a cylinder shape, but that's not an issue. This dish was all about chicken. The Plantain Ball stuffed with chicken, popcorn chicken, salad, and a chicken flavor sauce/soup for the ball. Although there was a lot of chicken, I liked the flavors.

Price: In my honest opinion, I think prices are fair.

originalText.text:
It might just be personal preference or I came in a bad day but everything was super salty and my lemonade almost gave me diabetes. I ate half the food because my liver started hurting from too much salt and gave the rest to a hobo. I can’t believe I spend almost 50$ here.
Next time I want dominican food I think I’ll just go to those pizza places that have DR food on the side cause this food is almost a health hazard or maybe it was just the cook who put too much of everything, I really dont know.
I’ve tried Mofongo del valle and the food is actually seasoned properly there.

I did like that the ingredients were fresh and the person next to me ordered a salmon which looked really nice and tasty, the pictures from other reviews look nice too and I wished I had ordered that.

Little tip I have is that if you order black rice with red beans, you have to specifically tell them a side of beans otherwise they will just give you black rice and charge you extra for the side. The beans on the black rice needed to be boiled for longer, they were starchy on the middle.

I hope to come back when a better cook is there because this place has potential and Id like to see it do better so I can stop going to Chipotle across the street

originalText.text: Best ever Dominican food in the neighborhood. Monfongo, roasted chicken, and seafood pasta are all my favorite meals of the restaurant. Highly recommend salmon and cow feet soup. The seating area is neat and the service is on rock! Definitely a go to place if you looking for down to earth dining options.

The seating area is neat and the service is on rock! Definitely a go to place if you looking for down to earth dining options.

originalText.text: Im a faithful customer but today s experience was awful. When you read about attitude issues this is the culprit. Not only she serves cold food, gives you no attention, no napkin, judging looks since you walk in and questions the legitimacy of your bills? Lady you went above and beyond in terrible customer service. People from el Cibao have common sense but this lady needs to be fired.

originalText.text: This place has the potential of becoming a great little spot but it has terrible customer service! I was literally standing there waiting for this women to take my order and she’s just scrolling on her cell phone talking with her friend. The only hard working employee is the tattoo guy at the front. . He needs a raise asap! I will not be going back!
